result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case Called: 9:39 am
INCLUDES 21CF1226, 22CF60, 22CF61, 22CF771.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Davis Runde in person.
Defendant appears in person, in custody, and with Atty Dan Cveykus in person;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to:
21CF1226:
Amend Count 1 to Count 1 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling-Domestic Abuse) pursuant to 943.14 & 968.075(1)(a).
Ct. 2 (False Imprisonment-Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.

22CF60:
Ct. 1 (Stalking-Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.

22CF61:
Ct. 1 (Burglary-Arm Self with Dangerous Weapon-Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety-Use of a Dangerous Weapon-Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (Disorderly Conduct-Use of a Dangerous Weapon-Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.
Ct. 5 (Battery-Use of a Dangerous Weapon-Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.
Ct. 6 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.

22CF771:
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
21CF1226:
Ct. 1 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling-Domestic Abuse)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 3 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse)>> NO CONTEST.

22CF61:
Ct. 3 (Strangulation and Suffocation-Domestic Abuse)>> NO CONTEST.

22CF771:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
21CF1226:
Ct. 1 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling-Domestic Abuse)>>Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, SAFE Program and Follow up, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, No Contact with Victim unless approved by agent, Participate in the Marathon County Probation Review Hearings, I/S 90 Days MCJ to be used for rule violations, I/S 90 Hours of Community Service to be used for rule violations, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge, Domestic Abuse Surcharge. Court finds 2 Days Credit if revoked.

Ct. 3 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse)>> Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, SAFE Program and Follow up, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, No Contact with Victim unless approved by agent, Participate in the Marathon County Probation Review Hearings, I/S 90 Days MCJ to be used for rule violations, I/S 90 Hours of Community Service to be used for rule violations, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge, Domestic Abuse Surcharge. 

22CF61:
Ct. 3 (Strangulation and Suffocation-Domestic Abuse)>> Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, SAFE Program and Follow up, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, No Contact with Victim unless approved by agent, Participate in the Marathon County Probation Review Hearings, I/S 90 Days MCJ to be used for rule violations, I/S 90 Hours of Community Service to be used for rule violations, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge, Domestic Abuse Surcharge. 

22CF771:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony)>> Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, SAFE Program and Follow up, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, No Contact with Victim unless approved by agent, Participate in the Marathon County Probation Review Hearings, I/S 90 Days MCJ to be used for rule violations, I/S 90 Hours of Community Service to be used for rule violations, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge, Domestic Abuse Surcharge. Court finds 29 Days Credit if revoked.
